Activity: Login, check emails. Read the tech news.
Begin rigging the primary character. This involves creating a skeleton and attaching it to the character mesh. Use Blender's armature system.
Carefully place joints at the correct anatomical locations (shoulders, elbows, knees, etc.). This is crucial for good deformation during animation.
Lunch break. Grab a quick bite.
Weight paint the character, assigning different parts of the mesh to specific bones. This controls how the mesh deforms when the bones are moved.
Test the rig by posing the character in various positions. Identify and correct any areas with bad deformation.
Save, backup, document, shutdown. Browse Reddit for a bit.
